description: From Middle French germe, from Latin germen (“bud, seed, embryo”). Doublet of germen.

definitionGroups.group: (biology) The small mass of cells from which a new organism develops; a seed, bud, spore, or zygote.

entries.meaning: The embryo of a seed, especially of a seed used as a cereal or grain. See Wikipedia article on cereal germ.
(biology) The small mass of cells from which a part of an organism develops, or a macroscopic but immature form of that part; a bud.
examples: surgical removal of germs of wisdom teeth

entries.meaning: A pathogen: a pathogenic microorganism, such as a bacterium or virus.
(figurative) The origin or earliest version of an idea or project.
(mathematics) An equivalence class that includes a specified function defined in an open neighborhood.

verbs.description: germ (third-person singular simple present germs, present participle germing, simple past and past participle germed)

examples: Thus tempted, the lust to avenge me / Germed inly and grew.
I’m addicted, want to germ inside your love
